properties.areaDesc: Clear Lake/Southern Lake County; Southern Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Western Plumas County/Lassen Park; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Northern Lake County; Burney Basin / Eastern Shasta County; Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 2:54PM PST by NWS Sacramento CA
properties.description:
* Snow: 2 to 4 inches of snow from 6500 to 7500 feet including the
passes on Interstate 80 and Highway 50. 4 to 9 inches of snow
expected above 7500 with locally higher amounts approaching a
foot over Mount Lassen.

* Rain: One half to three quarters of an inch northern Sacramento
Valley, tapering to one to tenths of inch southward into the
southern Sacramento and northern San Joaquin Valley. Generally
one half inch to one and three quarters of an inch over the
foothills and mountains.

* Timing: Light rainfall tonight and Saturday over the coastal
range and Shasta County mountains. Heaviest precipitation
expected Saturday night and into Sunday.

* Impacts: Wet roads, and possible chain controls for the trans-
Sierra passes late Saturday night and Sunday morning.

* Synopsis: A modest Pacific storm will bring rain and mountain
snow to interior NorCal this weekend. The heaviest precipitation
is expected late Saturday night into Sunday morning. Snow levels
will be above the trans-Sierra passes until late Saturday night
and Sunday when snow levels are expected to lower to pass
levels.

NWSheadline: Valley Rain and High Elevation Mountain Snow over Interior Northern California this Weekend
